description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Oludeniz" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Oludeniz

places.generalDescription: Mavi Lag√ºn, also known as the Blue Lagoon, is a must-see destination in Oludeniz, Turkey. This famous site offers a day of sunbathing, water sports, and drinks at its cafes. Visitors can also explore private beaches like Sugar Beach or Seahorse with free entry and shuttle services to and from hotels. The area was originally known as Belcekiz before becoming a tourist hotspot.

sources.snippet: Separating into two parts, Belcekiz and the Blue Lagoon, tourists have flocked to Oludeniz beach in Fethiye since mainstream travel went global nearly 50 years ago. Overlooked by Babadag Mountain, Oludeniz‚Äôs location, nestled into a green valley dropping down from Hisaronu or Ovacik villages, opens marvellous views of sparkling turquoise water and white sand. The 14-kilometre drive to Oludeniz Beach from nearby Fethiye Town centre or just five minutes from either Ovacik or Hisaronu explains the intense popularity of these two towns for those who wish to buy beach property in Turkey.
sources.shortName: Oludeniz Beach guide Fethiye best beaches

sources.snippet: Oludeniz also known as Blue Lagoon is one of the most popular holiday destinations of Turkey and Europe. Its unique sea and fantastic view makes the village popular and one of the most photographed beach of the world. Oludeniz is a beach resort, full of hotel and hostels and great restaurants and bars on the beach side.
sources.shortName: About Oludeniz, General Information | Fethiye Tours

places.name: Blue Lagoon

reviews.text:
We arrived here in the afternoon and were absolutely stunned by the beauty of the place. In my opinion, this spot surpasses the white beaches of Thailand and Indonesia in terms of natural beauty and the crystal-clear water.

It's definitely worth a visit if you're in Fethiye. The breathtaking blue lagoon, surrounded by mountains and the sight of paragliders soaring in the sky, is unforgettable.

Where we were, there were no changing rooms or washrooms, and we didn't have to pay any parking fees. There was a private beach club nearby, but it was only accessible to members.

What an absolutely awful place. Overcrowded and abused. The private side is meant to be better but after viewing the peninsular part, we decided to leave. It has been abused by those that do not care about its continued existence. At the current rate, it will become desolute and will cease to exist.
It is meant to be a smoke free zone, it isn't! Even the parking attendant was smoking. There are people everywhere, on the beaches, along the pathways,  in the undergrowth ratherthan use the available sunbeds. I can understand why they want to use it as the sea is quite choppy, but  if they do not look after it, it will not exist for much longer. The queues of traffic to get in is shocking and brings Oludeniz to a standstill.
One of my favourite places ü•∞ the sand was nice and the sea was calm and crystal clear allowing us to swim And feel safe

places.generalDescription: √ñl√ºdeniz Beach is a stunning nature reserve known for its tranquil lagoon and picturesque curved beach. It has gained worldwide recognition for its natural beauty, with turquoise waters and a variety of exciting activities such as paragliding, swimming, scuba diving, camping in Butterfly Valley, and off-road safaris.

sources.snippet: From the moment we arrived at Oludeniz Beach Turkey, it was easy to see why many say it‚Äôs one of the best beaches in the country!. The bright blue sea glistened before us as dozens of travelers soared above Oludeniz paragliding. It was then that we walked further down to the beach clubs and caught a glimpse of the Oludeniz Blue Lagoon.
sources.shortName: 9 Awesome Reasons to Visit Oludeniz Beach Turkey

sources.snippet: √ñl√ºdeniz, a Blue Flag beach, is spotless, with small white pebbles meeting the crystal clear water. The water is calm and comfortable. There are hundreds of sun beds laid out in orderly fashion across the entire beach, but it wasn‚Äôt nearly as crowded as we had imagined.
sources.shortName: One of Turkey's Most Beautiful Beaches

sources.snippet: Oludeniz translates into the dead sea, but don‚Äôt expect doom and gloom. Instead, expect stunning scenery and turquoise lures of Turkey‚Äôs Mediterranean Sea. Construction in Oludeniz beach, a protected nature reserve of Fethiye, is strictly prohibited.
sources.shortName: Oludeniz Beach guide Fethiye best beaches

sources.snippet: This small, pebbly beach is a favorite for locals as it is small and quiet. The beach lies opposite Gemiler beach and is accessible by boat. You can get a lift to this beach from Gemiler for a small fee and boatman can pick you up later.

Since it is a public beach, there is no entrance fee, but sun loungers and umbrellas are paid. 2021 √ñl√ºdeniz Beach price is 15 TL per umbrella and sun lounger. Since Kumburnu beach is a national park, entrance fee is charged by vehicles.
sources.shortName: Where is √ñl√ºdeniz beach? How to get to √ñl√ºdeniz beach? Where is √ñl√ºdeniz lagoon?

places.name: √ñl√ºdeniz Beach

reviews.text: Great beach, super large with plenty going on in the area. Water was turquoise and crystal clear! Super beautiful, we went in the beginning of may and it was extremely empty and pretty peaceful.

its a really cool place. but be prepared: it is very crowded, they will charge you multiple times for different things. The sun shades are a bit small, you need to adjust your sun-bed constantly (if you have space of course). it has a locker tho' which is really handy, but didn't worked for us, but the staff did a workaround to fix it for us. :)
All together we had a blast at the bay, the water is very clear once you pass the shallow water. and if you up for exploring , you can climb the surrounding ‚Äúmini island‚Äù rocks. i wouldn't miss it!

Beautiful Beach. Love the scenery. It's pebbly, but the pebbles are smooth. Water is crystal clear. Beach has washrooms. Entrance was 100TL per person. No stamp or receipt to leave and come back. Parking is extra. We had a scooter and just parked it outside the gate for free.

sources.snippet: Separating into two parts, Belcekiz and the Blue Lagoon, tourists have flocked to Oludeniz beach in Fethiye since mainstream travel went global nearly 50 years ago. Overlooked by Babadag Mountain, Oludeniz‚Äôs location, nestled into a green valley dropping down from Hisaronu or Ovacik villages, opens marvellous views of sparkling turquoise water and white sand. The 14-kilometre drive to Oludeniz Beach from nearby Fethiye Town centre or just five minutes from either Ovacik or Hisaronu explains the intense popularity of these two towns for those who wish to buy beach property in Turkey.
sources.shortName: Oludeniz Beach guide Fethiye best beaches

sources.snippet: Dead Sea (means Oludeniz) is under protection as a national reserve. Even in the windy days and storms the sea here stays calm as a pool.
sources.shortName: About Oludeniz, General Information | Fethiye Tours

reviews.text:
Belcekƒ±z Beach, located in √ñl√ºdeniz near Fethiye, Turkey, is a stunning coastal destination renowned for its breathtaking scenery and clear turquoise waters. Framed by a dramatic mountainous backdrop, the beach is primarily composed of coarse sand and small pebbles, making it a unique spot for sunbathing and swimming.

Visitors can enjoy facilities such as sunbeds, umbrellas, showers, and changing areas. It's also a prime spot for paragliding, with colorful gliders soaring above, offering spectacular views of the region. The nearby promenade is perfect for evening strolls, and the beach's serene environment is free from street vendors, enhancing its relaxing ambiance. Belcekƒ±z Beach serves as a gateway to explore other attractions in the area, such as Butterfly Valley and the Lycian Way.

We love this beach. We come here every day this week for our holiday. There are clean toilets available. Shame that some tourists don't pick up their own litter and don't keep toilets clean after them.
The locals try their best to keep everywhere clean and tidy.
The sea is super clean and not too salty. We really enjoyed swimming here. We will definitely come back.

Belcekƒ±z Plajƒ± is an absolute gem that deserves every bit of its 5-star rating. The beach boasts an array of fantastic features that make it a must-visit destination.

First and foremost, the variety of bars along the shoreline is outstanding. Not only are there many options, but the prices are also remarkably reasonable. Whether you're in the mood for a refreshing cocktail or a simple snack, the beachside bars offer a delightful experience without breaking the bank.

And then there's the water ‚Äì perhaps one of the most stunning I've ever seen in Europe. The crystal-clear turquoise waters are simply mesmerizing. The cleanliness and clarity make it an ideal spot for swimming, and the picturesque surroundings add to the overall beauty of the beach.

Belcekƒ±z Plajƒ± provides a perfect blend of vibrant beach life and natural beauty. Whether you're looking to relax in the sun, take a dip in the captivating water, or enjoy a drink with a view, this beach has it all. A definite 5-star destination that should be on the list of anyone visiting the area.

places.generalDescription: Paradise Beach, Bar and Restaurant is a fantastic beachfront spot with a great atmosphere. The staff is incredibly friendly and provides excellent service. You can enjoy delicious food, including vegetarian options, at reasonable prices. The cocktails are amazing, and you can even sit in huts right in the sea. On top of that, there are DJ performances on Saturday nights for added entertainment. The shallow cove offers calm waters and the option to rent sunbeds and parasols at a reasonable price.

sources.snippet: Paradise beach is perfect for diving and snorkeling as the bay is full of fish. It is surrounded by pine forests so there is plenty of wood supply if you decide to camp and BBQ.

places.name: Paradise Beach, Bar and Restaurant

reviews.text:
Beautiful beach club, the friendliest staff in the whole of Fethyie! I'm not joking, I had the best smoothies and milk shake ever!!!!
You should try the Green ginger peach smoothie.
Plenty of parking, great music, beautiful theme and so welcoming!
Definitely coming back üòçüòç

We took the shuttle bus. Went from 11 - 6. It is a proper beach bar with Turkish music being played and the restaurant area is over the lagoon. You can take inflatables into the blue lagoon when you are there. There is enough shade for when you don't want to be in the sun all the time. There is also a swing set and a trampoline for the children which are all in the shade. The blue lagoon itself is a beautiful place to go if you have the opportunity.

The beach business is a complete fiasco, there is constant noise and noise both in the hotel and on the beach. Not only the vulgarity and loudness of the music, but also the cavalier efforts of a waiter named Mr Ersan to communicate with people by shouting. There is such an unprofessional simplicity that you don't realize that you are disturbing other people by shouting "Hello my friend!" out loud. Didn't we witness abusive speeches about the customers? As if the noise on the beach wasn't enough, we were exposed to the music the lady cooking was playing inside, with her swearings. We witnessed the staff shouting and using abusive language not only among themselves but also about the customers!..  It seemed like the staff came to have fun rather than to serve. Every second was like torture, the only time we had fun was after 21:00 in the evening, when the beach staff dispersed. We are terribly tired.

places.generalDescription: Easygoing beachfront restaurant & bar serving pasta, grills & pizzas, plus sushi & cocktails.

sources.snippet: Sea Me Beach is a private beach area that you will need to get to early during the peak summer months if you want to secure a sun lounger and parasol. This beach gets very busy, but it‚Äôs a great space to enjoy a beach day with calm waters and golden sand. There are also plenty of facilities on site, including food and refreshments.

places.name: Sea Me Beach

reviews.text:
Sea Me Beach, located in B√ºy√ºk Boncuklu Bay in Fethiye, Turkey, is a luxurious beach destination that blends minimalism with a bohemian touch, providing a perfect escape into nature. Known for its turquoise waters and stunning Mediterranean views, it offers an adults-only concept with elegant sunbeds, cabanas, and gourmet dining options. The beach features a fusion of Mediterranean and East Asian cuisine, paired with handcrafted cocktails, creating an unforgettable culinary experience.

Visitors can enjoy paddleboarding, sunset parties, and day-long DJ performances, making it an excellent spot for relaxation and entertainment. With a focus on comfort and exclusivity, Sea Me Beach promises a memorable seaside getaway. Entry fees are tiered, with options for regular areas or premium comfort zones.

This is the most beautiful beach I've ever been to. The atmosphere was amazing, great music, good restaurants, and everything you need to have a great time. It's a bit pricey but I think it is worth it.

I'm honestly surprised by some of the negative reviews about this place. Of course, everyone has their own experience, but for me, everything was great. The food was delicious, and I didn't find the sunbed prices unreasonable at all. The staff was quick and attentive throughout the day.

In the evening, we moved to their other section for an event-which, I have to say, had an even better atmosphere. The ambiance and the crowd were truly top-notch. However, the service during the event really fell short. It took forever to get drinks, and the alcohol was significantly overpriced. The line was so long and the prices so steep that no one in our group could actually enjoy a proper drink, let alone get tipsy.

Overall, it's a beautiful spot with a lot of potential, but the evening event experience could definitely be improved-especially the bar service.

places.generalDescription: Kumburnu Beach, located within Oludeniz Nature Park, offers a serene escape with its rocky shoreline and calm lagoon waters. Surrounded by lush greenery and mountains, this 2-kilometer stretch of beach is a designated natural park, providing a tranquil sea without waves. Ideal for families and non-swimmers, the beach features sun lounger rentals and picturesque views of paragliders in the distance.
places.name: Kumburnu Plajƒ±

reviews.text:
I had the chance to visit Kumburnu Plajƒ±, and I must say it was one of the most memorable beach experiences I've had in Turkey. I've traveled quite a bit and visited countless beaches, but there is something about this place that combines natural beauty, peaceful atmosphere, and thoughtful amenities in a way that makes it stand out. Let me share my experience in detail, because this gem deserves recognition.

The beach stretches out gracefully into a narrow strip of land that almost feels like it's hugging the turquoise waters on both sides. On one side you have the calm, crystal-clear lagoon of √ñl√ºdeniz, and on the other side, the open sea with its deeper blue shades. It's like standing between two worlds, and the contrast is truly mesmerizing. No matter where you look, the colors of nature feel surreal-greens from the pine-covered mountains, shimmering blues from the water, and the golden tones of the sand.

The water here is something else. I've swum in many places, but the lagoon at Kumburnu is one of the calmest, cleanest, and most inviting I've ever experienced. It feels like a natural swimming pool, with gentle waves, shallow areas perfect for families with kids, and deeper spots for confident swimmers. The clarity is unbelievable-you can see small fish swimming around your feet. I even brought a snorkeling mask, and it felt like exploring an aquarium. If you are a nature lover, you will appreciate how unspoiled and well-preserved this beach is.

One of the highlights for me was renting a sunbed and umbrella. Yes, there is a small entrance fee, and you pay extra for the sunbeds, but I found it absolutely worth it. The facilities are clean, organized, and well-maintained. There are showers, restrooms, and changing cabins close to the beach, which makes the whole experience more comfortable. The staff were polite and attentive, always making sure visitors had what they needed. For me, that balance between natural beauty and practical service is what makes a place perfect.

Food and drinks are also available on site. There's a beach caf√© where you can grab a cold drink, an ice cream, or even have a proper meal if you want to spend the whole day there without leaving. Prices are fair considering the location and the view you are enjoying. I had a Turkish g√∂zleme (stuffed flatbread) and a cold ayran, and it tasted even better while sitting under the shade with the lagoon right in front of me.

What I appreciated most was the versatility of Kumburnu. If you want a quiet and relaxing day, you can find a peaceful spot under the trees and enjoy the sound of the waves. If you're with family, the lagoon is incredibly safe and fun for kids. And if you're adventurous, you're right next to the world-famous paragliding spot of Babadaƒü Mountain. Watching colorful parachutes glide gracefully over the lagoon while you're lying on your sunbed is a sight you'll never forget. It adds a touch of magic to the whole experience.

Of course, like any popular destination, it can get crowded, especially in July and August. My advice is to come early in the morning or visit during May, June, or September if you prefer a calmer vibe. Even when it was busy, though, the beach never lost its charm. The natural beauty is simply too overwhelming to be overshadowed by crowds.

All in all, Kumburnu Plajƒ± is a must-visit. It's more than just a beach-it's an experience that stays with you. The combination of calm lagoon waters, dramatic mountain views, and excellent facilities makes it one of the best beach spots in all of Turkey. Whether you're a solo traveler, a couple, or a family, you'll find something here that makes your visit unforgettable. I left with a sun-kissed smile, salt on my skin, and a deep sense of gratitude for discovering this slice of paradise.

I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Fethiye or √ñl√ºdeniz. Trust me, once you step onto the sand of Kumburnu and dip into its turquoise waters, you'll understand why so many people call it one of the most beautiful beaches in the world.

This place has only one thing going for it. The crystal clear water. Yes, the sea is stunning. The water is turquoise color. Beautiful. And that's it.

The negatives heavily outweigh this single positive thing. First of all, the crowd is crazy. There is insane amount of people here and sun-beds with umbrellas are so tightly packed you barely have any space to move around. On top of that, there is lots of people that bring their own towels and umbrellas and mix in between. As I said, the it's insanely crowded.

Even the parking and the access road. If you are not there by 8am in the morning, be prepared to wait in a huge line of cars to enter the parking lot. We arrived around 10am, and waited around 25 minutes in the traffic in front of the parking lot.

Okay, this is not a deal breaker, crowd on a beach is nothing new. But, considering the prices and how expensive it is, it's a horrible deal. Parking is 500 TL, around 10‚Ç¨. Sun-beds with an umbrella for 2 people cost 1200 TL, or ~25‚Ç¨. And if you want to order anything from the restaurant, again, very expensive. And for what? For a low end and uncomfortable sun-beds, small umbrella, mediocre service and such a tight packing of people that you feel like a sardine in a can. Simply horrible experience.

All of this, while you have multiple beaches just 5-10min drive away from the city centre, that are more than half a price and more than double the enjoyment (same crystal clear turquoise sea, beautiful sandy beach, cheap parking, cheap sun-beds, cheaper restaurants, spaciousness and no crowd anywhere).

The view is great, but it is an overcrowded place, with to many sunbeds. Otherwise, in the middle of the Oludeniz beach it's more beautiful, not that crowded, with planty of empty sunbeds, a large place to put your own umbrella. First 3 pictures are from Kumburnu plaji, the last one is on the middle of the beach were we stayed.

places.generalDescription: Kuleli Beach Club is a hidden gem that captivates visitors with its stunning natural beauty and tranquil atmosphere. Nestled in a serene location, this beach club features inviting sun loungers along the pristine shoreline and charming Turkish Kosks, which provide cozy seating around a picturesque lake at its heart. The large platform extending into the crystal-clear waters invites guests to stroll or take a refreshing plunge into the sea.

sources.snippet: Smell of pine, crystal clear water and far enough from hassle of the town ‚Äì all this is Kuleli Beach (Kuleli Koyu). It is one of the remotely located Fethiye beaches - on Fethiye peninsula and has restaurant, toilets, shower cabins, sunbeds and umbrellas for rent. Kuleli is pebble, shallow beach so great for whole family and children friendly.

places.name: Kuleli Beach Club

reviews.text: Came here on the 7th Of August 2022 it was an amazing experience me and the family loved it. It is very child friendly the food and refreshments were sensational with a wide array of choices. The staff were fast and friendly making me and the family feel at home. This will be the place me and my family visit every time we come to Fethiye could not recommend it enough. Thank you from the Saleh family.

Cost: 20 TL Per Person is enforced whether or not you're actually renting out their seats and umbrellas. This is very expensive and they need to understand that making it expensive to enter makes me less likely to spend inside which is exactly what happened. They charge 20TL for children 12 and older. So heads up on that too.

Hygiene: They have decently clean bathrooms. We did not see any showers which was unfortunate. The seats were decent.

Food: They have food and drinks. Beers are 20 TL. Dishes with meat are around 30 TL. Tea is 3.50 TL. The prices are high but not crazy high. They work with a card system. So you load money in the beginning and pay with that card. They said they return the unused money when you exit. We did not buy anything so I can't report back on any more than that.

The beach: Rocky beach with beautiful clear and warm water.

Other options: if you have your own car there are similar places you can probably go to without having to pay per person. I would say most places will cost 25 TL to park your car and not take per person fees so this is quite a bit more than what most places cost.
Nice private beach, very clean and organized. The service and facilities are on point. The only downside would be a bit overpriced sunbeds and cabins.

places.generalDescription: Towered Beach offers a refreshing swimming experience in its clear teal waters, surrounded by well-maintained tropical greenery and convenient paved pathways. The beach features canvas tents for shaded relaxation and provides facilities for sunbeds and umbrellas. Nestled amidst smooth seas and rocky hills, it offers a serene natural setting. Visitors can also enjoy hiking around the island's mountainous terrain or take a peaceful scooter ride along the island's roads after a day at the beach.

sources.snippet: The scent of pine, crystal clear water and the village‚Äôs charming market places; It is possible to see and experience all these at Kuleli Beach (Kuleli Village). It is one of the beaches of Fethiye located a little far from the center of Fethiye and there is a restaurant, toilet, shower cabin, sun loungers and umbrella rental opportunities. The beach of Kuleli Bay consists of pebbles and is generally preferred by families with small children, since the sea is shallow.
sources.shortName: Fethiye Beaches - 13 Beaches with Details and Photos

places.name: Towered Beach

reviews.text:
5* nature beauty
5* service
5* stuff
4* price
4* #accessibility
Amazing place to enjoy peacefully the sea, to hike around the island mountain, and to stay very close to the city at the same time.
I didn't see any hiking trails, but the road around the island is very quite with only few cats per some time, so it's rather good to hike. If take a scooter it might be even more fascinating to ride around the island after a beach session, both directions bring up completely different horizons. I recommend to do both, but if you are limited in time take the one starting to the right (East direction) from the beach.
At the beach there are very comfortable chaise longs, restrooms, parking & savage place too. But might be argued that it's a bit expensive though. #accessibility is preserved by flat solid surface near the beach & accessible restrooms.
Be careful,that this beach is separated for men/women/family and requires special swim suites for women (closed). Price is 80TRL per person
We skipped it since the front guy said it is 1000TL per person to enter, July 2025!

places.generalDescription: Boncuklu koyu, also known as Boncuklu Bay, is a stunning coastal spot just a short distance from Fethiye's center. The beach is characterized by its pebbles and sandy shores, offering visitors the chance to enjoy the sparkling waters and expansive sea views. The bay's name originates from the small beads-like pebbles found beneath its clear waters.

sources.snippet: Boncuklu Bay got its name from the small pebbles under the water that look like beads. Located in the camlƒ±k Village region between Gokova and Mugla, the Boncuklu Bay beach is different from other bays due to its many important features.
sources.shortName: Fethiye Beaches - 13 Beaches with Details and Photos

places.name: Boncuklu koyu

reviews.text: This beautiful place is just something else -- the drinks the music the water the beds it's just all amazing and it's one of turkeys places you need to visit. Take the day out to relax and unwind in the peaceful cove it's unreal.
The nature is stunning, but unfortunately they sold this area to corporations focusing only on $$$

Crystal clear sea, perfect horizon line, pink sunset and the sun drowning in the mountains in the distance. The beach can be divided into 3 zones: paid, public, semi-wild. We were on the third, it is difficult to get to it, there is no path as such, but the beach itself is removed from large masses of people. The beach is rocky, the entrance to the sea is convenient, hedgehogs were not noticed, there are a lot of fish to swim in glasses.

places.generalDescription: Blue Lagoon Sitesi is a popular spot that many recommend visiting while in the area. The pools are clean and offer a perfect view of Fethiye. It's an affordable place to stay, with nice rooms, although some guests found the cleaning to be inadequate. While some may prefer the beautiful beach of Olu Deniz over the Blue Lagoon, it's still considered a must-visit activity for most travelers in the region.

sources.snippet: Often referred to as the Blue Lagoon, √ñl√ºdeniz is a prime destination on the Turkish Riviera, attracting travelers from around the world. With its sandy bay, turquoise waters, and lush surroundings, √ñl√ºdeniz offers a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure. This article explores the many attractions and activities that make √ñl√ºdeniz Beach a must-visit for travel enthusiasts.
sources.siteName: Tourism Turkey: Top Travel Spots and Tourist Attractions
sources.shortName: √ñl√ºdeniz Beach, Fethiye - Turkey: Best Beaches to Visit 2025

places.name: BLUE LAGOON Sƒ∞TESƒ∞

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) For those who love to live in nature, away from the city noise, the view from the windows is stunning

(Original)
–î–ª—è —Ç–µ—Ö, –∫—Ç–æ –ª—é–±–∏—Ç –∂–∏—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–¥–µ, –≤–¥–∞–ª–∏ –æ—Ç –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —à—É–º–∞, –≤–∏–¥ –∏–∑ –æ–∫–æ–Ω –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—è—Å–∞—é—â–∏–π
Incredible views from there. Unfortunately the maintenance of the buildings is lacking
Stay away

places.generalDescription: K√º√ß√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ± is a hidden gem that perfectly embodies the serene beauty of Turkey's coastline. Known for its stunning views and crystal-clear waters, this beach is also a popular paragliding spot, making it an exciting destination for adventure seekers. Visitors rave about the cleanliness and well-maintained facilities, with friendly staff always ready to assist. The beach offers comfortable loungers at reasonable prices, allowing guests to relax without breaking the bank.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôve ever seen an advertisement for √ñl√ºdeniz, in fact, for Turkey‚Äôs beach resorts in general, you‚Äôve seen this beach. It‚Äôs also the most famous spot for paragliding.

places.name: K√º√ß√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ±

reviews.text: Nice beach in quiet forrest with sundbeds on the sun or in the sun shadow. Entrance is 300 lira per person and they have amazing staff always ready to take your order! Food is really good and prices are resonable. Recommendation!

We loved this place. Of course we came on a day that wasn't super full so that definitely helped to have a better experience.
They have different options of sun beds and umbrellas, you can choose any of them after paying the entrance fee which is 600 TL.
The food was very nice too and the service was perfect, we want to thank specially our waiter Arda for taking very good care of us and being so helpful and nice.
I saw comments about the beach being too rocky, to be honest it wasn't a problem at all, it's not even that rocky.
Also no fish was biting you üòÖ
We will be back

I've had the pleasure of visiting K√º√ß√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ±, and it truly left an impression I'd love to share-this hidden gem offers a perfect blend of natural beauty, thoughtful amenities, and a deeply calming atmosphere.

From the moment I arrived, the setting felt like stepping into a tranquil sanctuary. Nestled along a quiet peninsula near Fethiye, this cove is embraced by green hills and pine trees, offering shade and a lush backdrop to the shimmering Aegean waters. Ôøº The beach isn't large-roughly 130 meters of golden sand mixing with pebbles-but its size only adds to the intimate and peaceful vibe. Ôøº

The water here is nothing short of magical-clear, calm, and inviting. At times, it resembles an aquarium, especially on windless mornings when the surface is glassy. Ôøº I did notice some sharp rocks along certain entry points, so I'd highly recommend wearing water shoes for a more comfortable entry. Ôøº

Despite being privately operated, the beach maintains an affordable and welcoming feel. There's a modest entrance fee-around 300‚ÄØTRY per person during peak season-to access the beach, including amenities like sunbeds and umbrellas. Ôøº It's worth every kuru≈ü because the staff are exceptionally friendly and attentive, consistently ready to take your order or assist as needed. Ôøº

Convenience is a priority here. A well-positioned parking area lies close to restrooms, showers, and changing cabins. Ôøº Ôøº Even when parking isn't free, it's well worth it for the comfort and peace of mind it offers. Ôøº

Facilities go beyond the basics-there's a neat caf√©-bar on site with a menu of snacks, sandwiches, pasta, and refreshing drinks, all reasonably priced. Ôøº The place has a relaxed, upbeat vibe, with nice music in the background that enhances the ambience without ever being overpowering. Ôøº Ôøº

One of the most special moments for me was spotting sea turtles gliding near the cliffs-unexpected, delightful, and soul-stirring. Ôøº

Timing your visit can enrich the experience further. I chose to go in May, and the beach was peaceful-practically deserted at times, giving me a rare sense of personal paradise. Ôøº In contrast, summer weekends can bring more locals and families, which is great if you enjoy a livelier scene-but if peace is what you're after, May, June, or early September are golden months.

Of course, everything isn't perfect. The rocky entry points and occasional slippery wooden decking mean caution is advised. Ôøº Ôøº Also, there are small complaints about occasional maintenance needs, like slippery steps or algae on some platforms-but these are minor in context. Ôøº Ôøº

In sum, K√º√ß√ºk Samanlƒ±k Plajƒ± is a standout-serene, beautifully maintained, and just the right blend of service and natural charm. Whether you're looking to escape for a quiet swim, enjoy a peaceful sun lounger under the trees, or spot a sea turtle while sipping a cold drink, this beach delivers in spades. A hidden slice of coastal heaven near Fethiye that I wholeheartedly recommend.

places.generalDescription: SeaVenture Water Sports is your go-to destination for an unforgettable aquatic adventure at Oludeniz Beach. With a plethora of water activities available, there's something for everyone, regardless of age or skill level. Families can enjoy scenic boat trips to stunning spots like Butterfly Valley and various picturesque bays, all while being guided by the friendly and attentive staff.

sources.snippet: Oludeniz Beach offers a variety of water activities to suit different interests and skill levels. Below are more details about some popular options, including their costs, duration, and age restrictions.
